rev.desc.rev.desc: After 9.41 upgrade smin eventin records do not process as expected
AGMRQ10H2719, event in service also triggers the workflow rule sets.
The axces.sm and axces.apm RAD Applications set operator() function to NULL
backup the operator() value in start panel of axces.sm and axces.apm, and restore it when the rad is end, in axces.sm:cleanup and axces.apm:exit.normal/exit.error
the same way as axces.rm/cm3,
QCCR1E67361
The axces.sm and axces.apm RAD Applications set operator() function to NULL
operator get reset when process the cleanup
remove the operator()=NULL in panel cleanup
Background events happening regardless of the value of $bypass.failed.validation.
panel: update.event.fields....modified the expressions so that the message posted to the eventin record is based on whether or not the add/update/close was successful.

Modified the call.se.process panel to pass the following two parms: Variable Names {"$L.init.action"} and Variable Values {$L.action}, allowing a specific action to be used by the cc.first.log Process record when calling RAD=cc.save
replaced call to cc.save.incident with calls to doc engine (se.get,object and se.call.process); the doc engine calls had been removed between SC5 and SC5.1 (not sure why)

moved previous fix for 25463 to make sure it happened AFTER the field mapping, but BEFORE the format control processing in cc.save.incident which is where the update description is being posted; also initializes timezone to GMT prior to the field mapping to ensure date/time fields are mapped correctly
changed exit.error.msg to check for a lock and unlock if necessary
Modified query for prevous change.
Made changes as per Phil:

"i solved the issue by having it query for the event user, default to external if no user was given, and then nullsub with what was in the company record. then set the timezone to whatever i got. i have attached my unload."
Replace evsysseq in $L.event on panel write.output with evusrseq in $L.event, also changed Registration passed from $L.type to evtype in $L.event
Added a parameter (text) to allow the output event type to be specified.
If none is specified it defaults to smout.

descript.descript: After 9.41 upgrade smin eventin records do not process as expected
AGMRQ10H2719, event in service also triggers the workflow rule sets.
The axces.sm and axces.apm RAD Applications set operator() function to NULL
backup the operator() value in start panel of axces.sm and axces.apm, and restore it when the rad is end, in axces.sm:cleanup and axces.apm:exit.normal/exit.error
the same way as axces.rm/cm3,
QCCR1E67361
The axces.sm and axces.apm RAD Applications set operator() function to NULL
operator get reset when process the cleanup
remove the operator()=NULL in panel cleanup
Background events happening regardless of the value of $bypass.failed.validation.
panel: update.event.fields....modified the expressions so that the message posted to the eventin record is based on whether or not the add/update/close was successful.

Modified the call.se.process panel to pass the following two parms: Variable Names {"$L.action"} and Variable Values {$L.action}, allowing a specific action to be used by the cc.first.log Process record when calling RAD=cc.save
replaced call to cc.save.incident with calls to doc engine (se.get,object and se.call.process); the doc engine calls had been removed between SC5 and SC5.1 (not sure why)

moved previous fix for 25463 to make sure it happened AFTER the field mapping, but BEFORE the format control processing in cc.save.incident which is where the update description is being posted; also initializes timezone to GMT prior to the field mapping to ensure date/time fields are mapped correctly
changed exit.error.msg to check for a lock and unlock if necessary
Modified query for prevous change.
Made changes as per Phil:

"i solved the issue by having it query for the event user, default to external if no user was given, and then nullsub with what was in the company record. then set the timezone to whatever i got. i have attached my unload."
Replace evsysseq in $L.event on panel write.output with evusrseq in $L.event
Added a parameter (text) to allow the output event type to be specified.
If none is specified it defaults to smout.
